Verse: This is where we used to live
This is where we used to live
This is where we used to live
Tore the phone out of the wall
I want them back (This is where we used to live)
I want them back (This is where we used to live)
I want them back (This is where we used to live)
Chorus: Why did you paint the walls?
Why did you clean the floor?
Why did you plaster over the hole I punched in the door?
This is where we used to live
Why did you keep the mousetrap?
Why did you keep the dish rack?
These things used to be mine
I guess they still are, I want 'em back
Why did they pave the lawn?
Why did they change the locks?
Why did I have to break in, I only came here to talk
This is where we used to live
How is her temper this year?
And stomped on the floor just for fun
Bridge: I know we don't live here anymore
We bought an old house on the Danforth
She loves me and her body keeps me warm
This is where we used to live
